data.title: ‘Fubar’ is F****ing Hilarious
data.meta_description: The Netflix show Fubar, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, is a fusion of action and comedy that lives up to its promise. While not without its critics, it’s essential to remember that in today’s…
data.text:
The Netflix show Fubar, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, is a fusion of action and comedy that lives up to its promise. While not without its critics, it’s essential to remember that in today’s diverse entertainment landscape, dissenting voices are common. What truly matters is that Fubar succeeds in delivering what it sets out to achieve — feel-good entertainment sprinkled with a generous dose of rollicking good mayhem.

My personal journey with watching Fubar did have a rocky start. Attempting to dive into its world during the early morning hours left me initially underwhelmed. It was perplexing because, on paper, this show had all the elements I was seeking. However, as I persisted — actually switching the time I watched the show to later in the evening, giving it a more “Primetime” feel — I was drawn into the madcap universe of the series and it became clear why it’s garnered such a passionate following.

Created by Nick Santora, it notably marks Arnold Schwarzenegger’s first leading role in a scripted live-action TV series. Produced by Skydance Television and Blackjack Films, the series debuted on May 25, 2023, and swiftly earned a second-season renewal in June 2023.
